adrFormatAddress: 241 E 60th St, New York, NY 10022-1401, USA

originalText.text: It was an absolute pleasure working with Carlos and his team. Being based in Dallas, they made it so easy to detail a pair of ceiling lights I purchased from them for my client. Retrofitting the fixtures and getting them wired up, Carlos attended to every detail. The fixtures were one of my client's favorite pieces of the new renovation. I look forward to working with Carlos again.

I look forward to working with Carlos again.

originalText.text: Carlos is a pleasure to work with!  I live in CA, and although I haven't been able to visit the actual store (someday, I will!), he is always very responsive and incredibly helpful via email!  Highly recommended for anyone in search of high end antiques.

text.text: Carlos is a pleasure to work with!  I live in CA, and although I haven't been able to visit the actual store (someday, I will!), he is always very responsive and incredibly helpful via email!  Highly recommended for anyone in search of high end antiques.

originalText.text: Carlos de la Puente has a vast selection of light fixtures, from the sublime and the extraordinary to the simplest and most classic. He's definitely at the top of our favorites list.  We love his remarkable inventory and beyond this, really appreciate his expertise, service and reliability.

text.text: Carlos de la Puente has a vast selection of light fixtures, from the sublime and the extraordinary to the simplest and most classic. He's definitely at the top of our favorites list.  We love his remarkable inventory and beyond this, really appreciate his expertise, service and reliability.

originalText.text: Carlos de la Puente’s antique and vintage light fixture collection is unparalleled. He has three shops filled to the gills with light fixtures of every type and period. As a designer, I can usually find what I am searching for whenever I visit any of his 3 NYC locations on the Upper Eastside. They are conveniently located near the D&D building, as well as many design showrooms and antique shops, which makes it really convenient when traveling from out of town to do design shopping. Carlos and his staff are always friendly and helpful which makes it a pleasure working with them.

text.text: Carlos de la Puente’s antique and vintage light fixture collection is unparalleled. He has three shops filled to the gills with light fixtures of every type and period. originalText.text:
This professional delivers precisely what we are looking for in several lines of products.

Our offices in Boston need to have an updated "European Look" because we are located in the Back Bay.  Our building is America's original grand hotel in Beaux Art style built on Commonwealth Avenue in 1871.  It is the Vendôme building, which is an historic building and also the first commercial building in the United States to install electricity power.  Thomas Edison supervised the installation of the system.

Our salons are of grand scale and in 1975 the hotel was sold to create independent "condominium apartments", actually the original such development in Boston.  To do justice to Vendôme historicity, remodeling of the apartments needs to be in accordance with style and grandeur of the late 1800s and early 1900s.

Carlos De La puente Antiques in New York has been assisting us for 15 years in securing authentic pieces that will suit the style and legacy of the salons. We've needed period chandeliers and wall sconces, as well as bronze sculptures and mirrors.

Carlos has an exceptional eye for quality and his business has been going from strength to strength because of that ingenuity and professionalism.  Anyone needing well educated advice on the best finds for this style ought to begin his searches at Carlos De La Puente.  He offers two large showrooms filled with excellent stock, which turns over fast.  A homeowner should contact him as soon as his decorator has decided on the grand style for his house or apartment.
